Perceived_purpose1: In the Coin Flip Game one player is a sender and knows the outcome of the coin flip (heads or tails). They also know how much money will be paid in the game. They send a message to their partner whether it is heads or tails and they can earn money depending on if they choose heads or tails. If the other partner chooses the senders message and it is correct, they will split the money, but if they are wrong about the choice, that the sender sent inaccurate information, then only the sender receives money. The purpose of the game is if you can trust your partner sending correct information, or if they are lying and acting selfish for money.
Perceived_purpose2: The rely and verify game is similar to the coin flip game, but the receiver can verify, which means they always get money even if the sender sends correct or incorrect information. If the sender sends correct information and is the partner relies, the partner splits the money. If they verify, they choose to subtract a portion of their earnings and always get a fixed amount. If the information is correct, they split the money anyway but less. If information is incorrect, the person relying or verifying always gets money, but the person sending the information does not. The purpose is also similar to the coin flip game, and that you have to trust your partner, but can act accordingly depending on what side you are on.
